subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Intelligent Design: Science or Religion?
description: A quick win: understand Intelligent Design: Science or Religion?.

hook.text: Life is too complex to be random, they argue. A designer must exist. Is it science or creationism in a lab coat?

buildup.text: Intelligent design argues biological complexity points to a designer. It avoids naming God, trying to sound scientific.

discovery.text: In 2005, a court ruled ID is religion, not science. It lacks testable predictions and peer-reviewed research.

twist.text: ID asks a real question: can science explain why the universe seems fine-tuned for life? It just answers it badly.

climax.text: The ID debate shows that the line between science and religion is political, not just intellectual. Courts decide it.

punchline.text: Intelligent design asked a real question. Its answer was religion in a lab coat.

quiz.question: Why did courts reject intelligent design as science?
options: It lacks testable predictions and is essentially religious
